20352596.review:
今天手滑点进Steam商店页(哎呀瞧我这手滑),发现自己的弹幕启蒙作Sora居然登陆Steam了!果断砍手啊!
说到接触弹幕,那是在2010年,当时上B站看一个视频,标题大概是什么"当你看见子弹时你已经死了",是一个挺有意思的小游戏,名字忘了,但确实激起了我对STG的兴趣,正如那时候所有的弹幕游戏视频那样,凡是跟躲子弹稍微沾点边的,必有东方厨在刷"跟东方比弱爆了"之类的字幕,虽然立派STG厨都知道东方的难度在STG中属于中低水平,但"车万很难"的印象已经被深深植入我们不明真相的群众的脑中.
如果我就这样跳入了东方大坑的话,那就不会有这篇评测了,事实上在我奇特的脑回路下,我选择知难而退,退而求其次再找一款别的弹幕游戏来献上自己的雏♂菊,于是便找到了Sora,原因是当时我在一直订阅的<电脑游戏攻略>杂志(这不是打广告,那家杂志已经停刊了)上有一期介绍了Sora,而且还钦点它是"摆脱东方的影响在少女打飞机题材中开拓出一片新的领域",这倒正合我意,于是在2010年的深秋,一个怀揣着拯救地球梦想的少女在一个笨蛋机师的控制下一遍遍地被打成烟花的故事,开始了★
诚然,虽然Sora在弹幕游戏中难度也并不算高,但确实不乏有人连主菜单都进不去...(只有打通第一关后才会有主菜单,不然打开游戏后直接进第一关)当时我也是在2面3面被打的死去活来,估计应该是躺了有40多次,为什么我这么肯定?因为游戏中的武器ARTILLERY是要GameOver(无论是破关还是被打死)40次才能拿到,而我那时是拿到ARTILLERY才打通了3面,相比之下6年后的再开荒,打到6面才刚解锁了PILEBUNKER(GameOver20次) 与传统的STG相比,Sora更像是一个格斗游戏,它引入了一些格斗游戏的要素,最重要的是硬直,游戏中所有武器射击时都会产生硬直,在硬直时玩家是无法操作的,如果遇到弹幕来袭那只能白白挨打,避免硬直的办法就是做取消动作,取消动作可能是另一种武器的射击,也可能是冲刺,具体取决于当前硬直的武器,熟练的玩家可以通过取消动作来清除硬直,让自己的行动如行云流水般流畅.同时游戏还大胆地改变了以往STG以躲为主的游戏方式,而是改成了"以撞为主",当玩家进行冲刺时,所有的能量型(比如激光)弹幕不但不会对玩家造成伤害,还可以为玩家补充Hyper条(用于开bomb)甚至是回血,但是代价是会激增大量的热量,热量决定了玩家遭受攻击时收到的伤害,0%热量和最大热量时玩家被弹幕打一下掉的血能差出数倍,如果在最大热量时不小心停下来吃了一发弹幕的话,很可能一下掉半管血...另外冲刺不能让玩家回避诸如导弹之类的实弹类武器,幸好它们往往飞的不快,而且可以被玩家的武器击破.Sora通过硬直和冲刺的设定,将游戏风格控制在了一种快节奏的方式上,要求玩家能够合理地规划冲刺的路线、射击的时机和散热的管控.游戏中还提供了风险最高但收益最大的攻击方式:近战,近战的威力有多大?4面道中Boss可以在开火前被近战直接剁死...
如果要说缺点的话,也许是操作有些别扭?不过Steam版倒是可以改键位.


[i]
最后,就是喜闻乐见的剧透
	从此开始 1光年 
		↓[/i]

Sora的故事设定在未来,大概就是那时候的人类变得跟COD:G中的南北美洲那样,整天除了打仗和造兵(❤)以外什么也不干了,我们的主角Sora,在出生后被认定为有资质成为"最终兵器",于是在被经过改♀造后成为了一个能从胯下- 不,从裙下掏出各种神兵利器的人形兵器娘(有兵器少年吗?有哦♂),经过疤面女Sham的简单培训后,带着不靠谱的后援去上岗执行第一次任务!
Sora的第一次行动是在一个被雾霾覆盖的地方,视野中所见的只有远处一团团爆炸的火光,和浓雾中若隐若现的敌机,在开局不利的情况下,我们的最终兵器还是以摧枯拉朽之势击溃了敌人的防线,直逼对方的指挥官 - 兵器娘Alte,在劝降无果后,Sora击败了Alte,却被老谋深算的Alte用色诱+自爆干掉了,[strike]游戏终[/strike].
击落后的Sora被一个支乎理工男捡回了家,在经过一番调教后(自行脑补大量男女男),Sora屈服于理工男的大屌下,开始为理工男的理想:[strike]消灭人类暴政[/strike]绿化地球而奋斗,再次出战的Sora抬手就宰了奉命前来猎杀[strike]进行净水计划的[/strike]科学家们的[strike]英克雷[/strike]兵器少女Tsih和兵器少年Mira(这家伙有点意思,说话时总称自己为"我们",开始以为是深井冰,后来看AOS2的背景设定才知道她本来也是个兵器少女,在身子被打烂了后大脑移植到了一个脑死亡的汉子身上),这一次Sora没有留情,直接将对方放了烟花.
化解了敌人攻势的Sora却丝毫没有感受到任何胜利的喜悦,正如Mira所说,"我们也是在保卫我们的国家,保护我们的人民,就像你所做的那样...我们都是战争的一部分",内心迷茫的Sora在海上漫无目的游荡着,却与自己的老熟人,前来"回收"自己的疤面女Sham不期而遇,在了解到Sora的目标后,Sham忍不住嘲讽"你帮谁不是帮,帮我们把敌人都咔嚓掉那不也能结束战争吗?" 在与Sora沟通无解后,两个昔日故友大打出手,正所谓最大的敌人是自己人,熟悉主角弱点的搜捕部队专门携带了抑制Sora冲刺能力的设备,经过一番苦战后,Sora迂回击破了抓捕自己的部队,并重创了沦为光杆司令的Sham.
"即使有多少个你,这场浩大的战争也不可能被停止!" 
"但还有一种办法,可以保护我想保护的人..."
"难道...如果你杀了那个人,我绝对不会原谅你...但如果你真的能让这场战争停下来,我会还你一个微笑."
于是在主角奇异的脑回路下,Sora直着杀向了自家的总部...真是不得不吐槽主角的智商了,你有这能耐宰了敌人的司令不好吗...杨威利那么想结束同盟和帝国的战争,也没抬手把海尼森炸了.首都的防卫军早已得知主角的来意,铺天盖地的机甲和无人机集结在通往总部的大桥上,用激光与空雷在天空中编制出一张火网,一道倩影从空中飞过,身后留下的只有纷纷坠入海中的残骸.雾蒙蒙的天空下,一个孤单的身影悬在总部的上空,怀着复杂的心情凝视着自己的前任.在那里,Sora遇见了自己的接替者,新的最终兵器 - 人棍妹子Nath,正在所有人的注视下恭候着叛逃的前最终兵器的到来.面对主角,Nath解释道所有人都知道战争只会以地球的毁灭收局,但对胜利的渴望推动所有人将这场战争继续进行下去,即使作为新的最终兵器,Nath亦坦言自己也不希望人类落得这样的下场,但却是身不由己,为了适应强化,她的双臂已被截去,自己除了作为兵器参与战争以外已是别无它用(我:妹子我看你也是细腰大奶,拿去作为肉●器用来造兵怎么样呀 (拖走)),最后Nath告诉了Sora一个"好消息",拜她的猛烈进攻所赐,如今全军中唯一仍有战斗力的只剩下Nath了,"我倒是好奇当你杀死我后战争能否如你所愿结束," Nath幽幽地说道,同时启动了武装程序,巨大的战甲被直接传送入战场,"你这样毫无意义,你的表达甚至无法自圆其说..."
新老两个最终兵器悬在城市上空,等待着最后时刻的降临,谁也没有注意到灰色的天穹之上,另一支军队正悄然接近.
"开始吧,我也会全力以赴的."
今日的弹幕,又是这样的绮丽.

游戏的故事告诉了我们两件事:1.Sora其实是个以环保为主题的游戏 2.不要小瞧草食男对妹子的洗脑 [strike]3.支乎好危险![/strike]

20342836.review:
Si vienes aquí a leer los análisis solo para saber si el personaje bonus de 100% Orange Juice vale la pena, te estarás cerrando a lo que es un grandioso juego como lo es Sora.

No voy a detallar mucho puesto que como noob/poco acostumbrado a juegos bullet hell que soy, he quedado demasiado impresionado y quizá mi análisis no sea preciso. Pero al menos toma en cuenta que ha impresionado a este pagano de los bullet hell. 

OST grandiosa, diseño artístico sublime, y una jugabilidad agradable -al menos, repito, para un noob como yo-. Altamente recomendado, aunque de momento tiene algunas caídas de frames en situaciones con muchos rayos, y en mi caso el opening iba entrecortado, pero eso no me impidió jugarlo hasta terminar la historia principal, y no debería detenerte a ti tampoco.

Edito: He decidido hacer un servicio a la comunidad, y analizar a los personajes bonus de 100% Orange Juice que se obtienen al comprar ciertos juegos.

Sora (Military)
HP: 4
Stats: +1/0/+1
Especial: Cuando cae K.O. en batalla, revive automáticamente en su próximo turno, pero con 2 HP.
Hyper: Awakening of Talent. (Boost). Nivel: 2. Costo: 20 Stars. Hasta el final del turno, el usuario lanza 5 en su dado para moverse, para batalla, para Drop y para Bonus. Esta carta también puede activarse como carta de batalla.

Una interesante variante a la Sora regular, aunque muy similar, a diferencia de las otras parejas de personajes Bonus vs Regular (hasta ahora). El hecho de que puedas activarla en batalla, le da un factor sorpresa que Extraordinary Specs no puede ofrecer, pero esa tirada de 5 en lugar de los 6 de ES puede significar mucha diferencia. Su especial es muy bueno para aquellos que detestan lanzar el dado para revivir, como yo, y así no pierdes tiempo en buscar venganza sobre el que te dejó K.O... aunque claro, el revivir con 2 HP te hace pensarlo mejor. 

Su bgm es excepcional, me encanta y está entre mis favoritas.

20340540.review:
Sora is a prequel to Suguri.  The graphics have been amped up and the mechanics are much more smooth compared to it's predecesor.

The story, this time around, is about a time when Earth is in a state of perpetual war.  Sora, a creation of war, is a new model sent out to defeat her enemies.  Instead, however, she joins some scientists who wish to end the perpetual state of destruction of the planet to make the planet return to it's original luster.

In terms of difficulty, this game is not as hard as Suguri, but it is still quite challenging.  I've played the Japanese version long ago and can recommend this game for anyone who enjoys fast paced shooter action.  Getting used to that kind of gameplay can take some time, though.

20330287.review:
I played this before Steam happened, and after I learned of Suguri.

This is a very good shooter game with a lighter difficulty than Suguri due to more weapons, slower pace, less solid projectiles, and the fact you are absolutely the ultimate weapon. 
This doesn't mean it's easy, though: If you're bad, you probably won't even reach the main menu. Even if you don't get stuck, have fun at level two.
You get a variety of weapons through 8 stages in order to stop the war as Sora, a perfect cyborg who is trying on their own to stop the war from destroying absolutely everything. Your tools at the beginning are shields, a bazooka, a beam rifle, and the ability to dash through energy projectiles to charge your hyper gauge for an overpowered attack to combat against some of the crazy barrages the enemies throw at you.
Overall, Sora is a solid successor to Suguri, which enjoyed only a small following before it hit Steam under a (rather poor) rival publisher, and may or may not be accompanied by an excellent fighting game.

I have to give this thumbs up for obvious reasons.

20329869.review:
[I] This key was obtained from the developer for the purposes of review. [/i]

[u] Summary: [/u]
Like extremely difficult games? Sora is right up your alley then. But for me, Sora provided an experience that immediately overloaded my frustration meter. A good amount of it comes down to the design of the game. While the heat and dodge mechanics are interesting and work at their core level, the level design leads to TOO much chaos on screen, that happens in an unpredicatable way at times. The game despite having a cancel system to counteract it, asks for reaction times that are way too small, and this is complemented by some unfair elements such as getting hit off screen, or asking too much of the player (by having hints of where boulders are coming in such a light hue of color that you're literally squinting to see it). It's a game that falls apart when it comes together, as while some elements definitely could work on their own with the aesthetic and the music, they don't combine together very well and don't complement each other in terms of gameplay. If you have a high frustration limit, then Sora's core combat will intrigue you. But if you don't, all you'll be doing is cursing. 

[b]  Video Review: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Fgu0_Bw-xec[/b]

[u] Lists: [/u]
[b]+:[/b]
[list]
[*] Core concept and gameplay works, in particular with the dodge/heat mechanic. Risk/reward element in that case works, as there's reasons to dodge and reasons NOT to dodge at certain times. 
[*] Cancel mechanic interesting on the surface, allowing for more tactics and keeping the action up. Again, good reasons to use and not use at certain times.
[*] Like the fact in particular that just MOVING makes sense at times, as opposed to dodging. For some games, it becomes too reliant on those dodge mechanics.
[*] Controls work for the most part. Dodging may be too fast, but good control.
[*] Trance music soundtrack works to complement the action very well.
[/list]

[b]-:[/b]
[list]
[*]  Elements of unfair difficulty. Get regularly hit by things off screen or asking way too much of a player to react to.  
[*]  Some games are a sum of their parts, but that's not Sora. Elements feel like that don't connect very well together, like different teams were working on 
[*]  Aesthetic clashes with gameplay. Hard to see live ammo makes dodging it rather difficult, and too much happening on screen can lead to your eyes straining at the smallest thing.
[*] Felt like the dodging mechanic could have done better with a more open level design. The speed at which you dodge and the amount of space to work with don't seem to complement very well.
[*] Lock on can get really annoying at times, due to the having to turn it off in certain cases. Especially on cases where an enemy is too big for the screen. 
[*] Sound design is lacking in certain places, not allowing for a good Oompf factor. Characters end up feeling a little lifeless because of this.
[*] Some polish issues. Needs prompts to indicate options at times (skipping with the LockOn Button) In battle menu should have the ability to go to the options menu. 
[/list]

20329461.review:
シューティングというより、死に覚え弾幕アクションと言った方が理解が早いかもしれない。

[h1]■特長[/h1]
このゲームの特徴はなんと言ってもダッシュですね。
ダッシュを使えばビーム属性の敵弾をすり抜ける事ができます。
なので一見弾幕が厳しいゲームに見えますが、やってみると案外なんとかなります。
すり抜けやダッシュ攻撃、ダッシュキャンセルを上手く使ってかっこよく戦おう！
リプレイ機能も付いてます。

[h1]■難易度[/h1]
慣れないとイージーでも中々やり応えのある作品なのですが
敵の出現や行動パターンは決まっているので、何度も遊んでコツを掴めばクリアできるようになっています。
そして、クリアできなくても何度も遊んでいる内に新しい武器が開放されていくので
中々進めなくてもモチベーションの維持はできるかと思います。
100回死んで強くなろう。

[h1]■総評[/h1]
私は所謂シューティングが苦手なのですが
すでに持っていてもSteam版が出たと聞いて即買いする程度にはこのゲームが好きです。
確かに難易度は高めなのですが、無理ゲーレベルでは無いですし（SP除く）
やり応えのあるゲームを求めている人にはオススメです。

20329258.review:
Sora takes Suguri’s foundations and, while it doesn’t change a lot, it does focus them. Under-performing weapons have been sharpened, and those that bordered on overkill have been dialled down a bit. There’s a greater sense of punishment for dash abusers, and a refining of the oft-fuzzy visuals. Scoring chains are also a bit more reasonable, no longer punishing you unfairly for pauses in between the action. But it’s that distinction between the girl soldiers and the pedestrian weapons of war that remains the game’s highest selling point. Most missions see you take on the obligatory weapon platforms, massive tanks or attack crafts, but end-of-level bosses match you against a girl with similar talents, forcing you to unlearn a lot of the scrolling shooter tropes that have been drilled into your head.

Full Review // http://www.honestgamers.com/12813/pc/sora/review.html

20329211.review:
[h1][b]Intorduction[/b][/h1]
I have never been a fan of bullet hell games reason being is that I always can’t keep up with the action that is going on the screen and I usually give up if it is too hard but as for Sora I liked it in fact I loved it and it is quite addictive, because it is manageable for me and I could say I did have a great time playing Sora. Sora tells the story of its namesake: the lone enhanced human, Sora, and her struggle to protect a fading world. Enjoy breathtakingly fast-paced combat in the Suguri universe, with improved game system and graphics along with original trance music by DEKU.

[h1][b]Gameplay Elements[/b][/h1]
Onto the gameplay elements, I absolutely adore the “customization” that you can bring in 3 weapons of your choice which could be unlocked by progressing in the game which will be stronger than the stock weapons that is provided when you start out, and you can either use the unlocked weapons or just use the stock weapons to make the game more challenging.

In Sora sometimes you may find yourself using a sword or a melee attack which at first glance seems dangerous but it is a high risk high reward type of attack because when the attack connects, a short term and small barrier is formed that blocks off incoming attacks and that is what made the melee attack useful and usable.

[h1][b]Controls[/b][/h1]
I am playing Sora on PC with a keyboard and the controls are good. The default settings are are well thought out and it can be fully customize allowing you to bind any buttons you want on the keyboard. [no cramping of 2 hands onto 1 side of the keyboard] I think having a good controls are very important because who wants to play a game with 2 hands overlapping each other? That would be pure discomfort and a hassle to play.

A element you will take notice off is the soundtracks, the soundtracks are really great they fit into the battle that is happening in your screen it just makes the whole game feel more immersive and “cool” like you are really part of the fight, I absolutely love the soundtracks.

[h1][b]Do I recommend this game?[/b][/h1]
Do i recommend Sora? Yes, I definitely recommend you to pick it up if you are a fan off bullet hell and great soundtracks.
In addition, everyone who owns Sora will receive a free bonus character in 100% Orange Juice on Steam.
